description:
Solutions Architect (SA) is a key pre-sales technical position in Alibaba Cloud international business division. Our solution architects are experienced cloud architects with comprehensive IT knowledge and industry insight and are, ultimately, the key to success on implementing projects. Solutions Architects are responsible for developing solutions in Alibaba Cloud and helping customers and partners to develop their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
Responsibilities:
Closely work with customers to ensure their cloud architecture is successfully implemented by assisting them in building their applications and services on the Alibaba Cloud platform.
- Create and present solution architecture designs to C-level/senior personnel.
- Responsible for understanding the unique requirements of customers and partners, and provide appropriate technical cloud solutions and architecture designs based on Alibaba Cloud cloud services.
- Provide assistance to Alibaba Cloud customers and partners in migrating their existing IT system onto Alibaba Cloud platforms. This includes providing migration technique support for both applications and databases.
- Responsible for demo development and testing Alibaba Cloud services.
‚Äª Candidate who has professional Cloud Certificate from Alibaba Cloud or other Cloud vendors is preferred.
Requirements:
* A background in IT, computer science and/or cloud computing with a good understanding of networking, servers, storage systems, enterprise applications and the cloud.
* A minimum of 4 years experience working and consulting on enterprise architecture design and has a strong understanding of customer needs and requirements.
* Expert knowledge and understanding of cloud architecture design and familiar with architecture methodology and practice in internet based applications/websites. Must also be experienced with procedures and tools for application migration and cloud/virtualization/container solutions for enterprise customers.
* Familiar and hand-on experience with one of the public Clouds covering IaaS and PaaS services.
* Experience with one of the Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) technologies.
* Experience with Contianer/K8S and Serverless services and implementation, experience with SOA architecture design.
* Experience with RDS like MySQL or PostgreSQL or others, and experienced with NoSQL like Redis or MongoDB or others;
* Experience with BigData technologies like Hadoop eco-system is a plus.
* Excellent writing, proof-reading and editing skills. Able to create documentation that can express cloud architectures using text and diagrams.
* Able to work under high pressure, a quick learner with a passion for cloud technology. Able to think strategically about businesses, products and technical challenges.
* Good communication skills, a good team player and has professional attitude to work.
* Fluent in French and English, Chinese is a big plus.

description:
Our business:
We help industrial companies to accelerate their digital transformation and dramatically improve their operational efficiency and competitiveness with data, software and AI. Our clients include CAC 40 companies, as well as small and medium-sized companies on five continents and over 150 industrial sites.
What makes us special:
We offer a complete range of services, combined with the use of latest technologies, covering the entire lifecycle of data-driven solutions, from ideation, business value assessment, industrialized solution development, to deployment, run and scale.
Our positioning:
We seek long term partnership-relation with our clients. We can help them define their digital strategy and AI roadmap, build & run a solution, train, and transfer skills, set up and professionalize R&D or innovation units or digital & AI factories.
Our teams:
A virtuous combination of three areas of expertise:
Business expertise: industrial operations & engineering.
Technical expertise: data science, software engineering & devops.
Delivery management expertise: managing digital projects and setting digital factories.
Your missions:
As a Cloud Architect,you will design and participate in the implementation of cloud solutions to support the digital transformation of our clients. You will work in agile mode, in an international context, on industrial projects.
Your main missions :
Support pre-sales technical activities by translating client‚Äôs requirements into state-of-the-art architectures, while guiding customers through their digital transformation journey in the cloud :
Lead workshops to study and define customer requirements
Imagine and define the architecture that would best meet the specifications provided while taking in account the financial and security constraints of the client.
Handle and resolve technical questions and challenges encountered by clients during the first phases of their projects
Define deployment methodologies and integration of the solution into the existing client‚Äôs ecosystem.
Participate in pre-sales meeting with clients to present the envisioned architectures
Lead end-to-end architecture projects (web applications, data engineering & processing pipelines) involving intensive use of industrial data, with a focus on performance, scalability and security issues
Supervise the deployment and industrialization of the target architectures
Ensure the security and reliability of deployed environments
Work in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams, including DevOps, back-end, front-end, data, product and business skills to make every project a success.
Experience and skills required:
At least 2 years' experience in Architect or tech lead full stack role
You have experience with the following technologies:
Cloud: Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, OVH
Databases & storage : PostgreSQL, TimeScaleDB, Redis, InfluxDB, S3 and alike
Processing and scheduling: Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Synapse, Airflow, Argo, AWS Batch, AWS Step
Streaming: Kafka, RabbitMQ, Kinesis, SQS
Devops: Docker, Kubernetes
Moreover :
You have proven experience in cloud or hybrid architectures
You love architecture diagrams ! (Excalidraw, Draw.io)
You demonstrate technical leadership and are able to communicate complex ideas effectively.
You know how to challenge customer requirements and Fieldbox objectives in order to optimize the proposed architecture.
You successfully manage the complex constraints of a production application through analysis and resolution.
You are customer and solution-oriented and have excellent interpersonal skills.
Fluency in English
Knowledge of an industrial sector is a plus
Knowledge in python is a plus
Advantage and benefits:
Full remote possible (Metropolitan France only)
What about our offices
Bordeaux: meet with your colleagues in a peaceful and calm space with an amazing view on ‚ÄúLes bassins √† flots‚Äù
Paris: enjoy a coworking space on the top of the Montparnasse tower with a 360 view of Paris
What about our values :
Join a company which values care where everyone is in position to reach their full potential
You will work within an energetic team with a strong technical skill. Weekly engineering are organized every week to present and discuss technical topics
Create immediate impact on the company
A quiz is sent every month in order to improve your comfort at work
Fun Activity:
Afterwork every month with different theme ( bowling , board game , darts, beers bar, etc. )
Lunch break : outside lunchs, board game parties, and sport! (running, badminton, darts, yoga)
CTFs
Typical process includes 3 steps :
HR interview
Interview with operational team, aiming at testing your fit to the specific job,
Interview with one or several founders to validate the application

title: data architect

description:
Company Overview:
Second is a fast-growing company on a mission to bring services to e-commerce. We develop a solution tailored to the unique needs of large corporate clients (Siemens Enegery, Allianz, Suez etc..). Our platform offers unparalleled flexibility, enabling seamless transactions, from direct customer-seller bookings to sophisticated request-for-proposal processes. At Second, we're trailblazing in an uncharted territory, and we're looking for a Solution Architect to guide our Customers.
Position Summary:
You will be responsible for understanding the unique requirements of each customer and tailor our platform to meet those specific needs. To perform this role you will need to understand how to extend the platform's capabilities and ensure that customizations align with best practices and scalability. When engineering for customers you will be expected to provide recommandations that not only meet current requirements but also anticipate future needs. While customising and extending the solution, you will ensure that data flows smoothly between systems. The role also involves keeping up with industry trends and best practices, as well as seeking opportunities to improve the platform's capabilities and performance continually.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyze and understand client/project requirements.
Design and document architectural solutions to expand and customize Second.
Oversee system integration and data flow.
Identify and mitigate technical risks.
Ensure quality, security, scalability, and compliance.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices.
Engage with clients and our partners to ensure satisfaction.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.
Several years of experience in software development and architecture.
Proven ability to design and document complex solutions.
Expertise in system integration and API usage.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Project management knowledge
Awareness of industry trends and emerging technologies.
Customer-centric mindset and leadership abilities and top of experinece in customer-facing roles.
Why Second?
Pioneering Opportunity: Join us in shaping the future of service e-commerce from the ground up. Your work will have a lasting impact on the industry.
Small Team, Big Impact: Be part of a tight-knit team where your ideas and contributions are valued, and your voice is heard.
Growth Potential: As the first member of our solution architecture practice, you'll have the chance to shape the team's direction and grow with the company.
Innovation Culture: We encourage creative thinking, experimentation, and pushing boundaries.
If you're a forward-thinking engineer looking for a challenge that goes beyond the ordinary, Second is the place for you. Join us in redefining service e-commerce and leave your mark on the industry.
Second is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary range will also adapt to the experience of individual profiles.

Netatmo is all about the Smart Home! Our mission is to imagine for you products which will make your home safer and more comfortable.
Manage your home‚Äôs heating from our connected Thermostat - detect intruders thanks to our cameras embedding artificial intelligence and image processing - access the largest personal weather station network on earth. We collaborate with giant building construction companies such as Intuis, Velux and Legrand to share with them our product expertise and work together to revolutionize your homes.
We are a multinational team of 250 motivated and passionate people, with more than 20 nationalities represented amongst our teams and almost everyone working together under the same roof near Paris. Having raised more than 30M‚Ç¨ and won several CES prizes, Netatmo is looking for new talents to accompany its development.
If you want to be a part of the Smart Home revolution, don‚Äôt wait to apply!
Job Description
Your Responsibilities
The Project Solutions team mission is to evaluate all new Smart Home opportunities for Legrand group before being approved for development. Interfacing with product marketing entities from the group, external partners, and different R&D centers, high level problems are then transformed into well-defined business opportunities with consistent solutions.
To accelerate Legrand group Smart Home development, we are looking for a talented, dynamic and passionate Smart Home Solution Architect.
Your work will consist in
Gathering all inputs from the different stakeholders (internal and external).
Understanding pains, requirements, technical constraints, use cases, and business implications.
Pitching the opportunity to the right audience using adapted language (business/technical/C-level).
Proposing innovative solutions including phased approach to tackle this opportunity.
Reusing at most the existing development, R&D know-how, maintenance impacts.
Identifying clearly the gaps to fill versus existing platforms, clarify a pre-feasibility in agreement with Product Manager and Tech leaders.
Consolidating workload evaluation for the proposed solutions.
Handing-over the project ownership to the assigned Product Manager after internal validation while providing as much support as required.
More generally, you will become a permanent Smart Home referent:
Maintaining & improving knowledge of Legrand smart home portfolio and its business strategies.
Monitoring of IoT market, technological trends and strategic topics (reviews, fairs ...).
Given the overall on-going opportunities, roadmap proposal is part of the expected deliverables.

MS / engineering degree or similar

Ability to quickly grasp new technical concepts, compare and benchmark with competitors

description:
The
EIB
, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its newly created Centre of Excellence, a
(
Senior) Cloud Solution Architect (Azure) ‚Äì based in Poland
*
. This position will be part of
Group Corporate Services Directorate ‚Äì Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) ‚Äì Platforms and Services Department (P&S)
- Cloud Enablement Unit (CET)
located in the
EIB External Office in Warsaw, Poland
.
This is a full-time temporary position at grade 5/6 in Warsaw, Poland. The term of the contract will be 4 years.
internal benchmark (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure
Purpose
Are you ready to contribute to a sustainable future and be at the heart of the European Union's Climate Bank's digital evolution? The European Investment Bank (EIB) is on a strategic mission to integrate advanced IT technologies, enhancing our business efficacy and the interaction experience with our clients and partners. Our Digital Transformation's success is energized by the diverse array of our team's skills, profound expertise, and dedication to bringing our forward-thinking vision to life. While we‚Äôre headquartered in the vibrant city of Luxembourg, we‚Äôre excited to establish a Centre of Excellence in the dynamic hub of Warsaw!
We are on the lead of cloud transformation, empowering our teams and stakeholders to embrace the rhythm of change and innovation. As part of our Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE), you'll join a mission-driven team that's reshaping the EIB digital landscape. Our journey is about creating value, enhancing resilience, and paving the way for a future where cloud enablement is a cornerstone of business agility.
Your mission? To play a key role in developing the foundations of our cloud platforms, focusing on Azure. Your expertise will be key in designing and automating cloud infrastructures ensuring they're scalable, secure, and aligned with the EIB Group objectives.
Operating Network
You will report directly to the Head of Cloud Enablement Team. You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. As you will be based in Warsaw some business travel to the EIB Headquarters in Luxembourg is foreseen.
Accountabilities
Design and implement cloud solutions with a focus on Azure, while also leveraging AWS for a multi-cloud approach
Develop landing zones and blueprints in collaboration with technical teams to support scalable and well-architected cloud environments
Lead the design and automation of cloud infrastructure, ensuring it meets our digital transformation objectives
Support teams leading technology roadmap, by providing technology advice and, where applicable, assisting in the implementation of cloud components
Collaborate with Cloud Governance and program leads to establish guidelines, roles, and responsibilities across projects
Engage in continuous learning to deepen expertise in Azure and cloud technologies, including security, network architecture, storage, containerization, identity and access management, amongst other
Translate technical solutions into business value, making cloud technologies accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate closely with other teams‚Äô part of the CCoE in view of delivering the expected cloud transformation roadmap, especially in relation to items dependent or relying on cloud platform foundation capabilities (Azure)
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
At least 5 years of experience in cloud development and/or operations with the focus on architecting, building, maintaining, and securing cloud technologies
Proven experience of delivering underlying cloud platforms as product, (Azure) ideally within transformation programs, including rollout of new technologies.
Experience working with public, hybrid and on-premises private clouds would be an advantage
Extensive technological expertise in IT, in particular within Azure cloud domain (Public/Private services; Operations & Administration, Architecture, Security control services, Containerisation, hybrid cloud)
Up-to-date knowledge of market trends and developments in the domain and broader IT sector
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies
here
(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of
level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.
Additional Information
The remuneration of staff hired directly at a post in an external office within the EU may be adapted to the costs of living of the respective country. Please follow the link We invest in you.
We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
Deadline for applications:
This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until the positions are filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

description:
Why SoftwareOne?
SoftwareOne is a leading global software and cloud solutions provider that is redefining how companies build, buy and manage everything in the cloud. By helping clients to migrate and modernize their workloads and applications ‚Äì and in parallel, to navigate and optimize the resulting software and cloud changes ‚Äì SoftwareOne unlocks the value of technology. The company‚Äôs 8,900 employees are driven to deliver a portfolio of 7,500 software brands with sales and delivery capabilities in 90 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, SoftwareOne is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange under the ticker symbol SWON. Visit us at https://www.softwareone.com/en
The role
We are looking for a Senior Google Cloud Architect with a history of creating and implementing
strong cloud solutions. You should have a deep knowledge of cloud architecture
principles, industry best practices and the ability to transform complex business needs
into technical solutions. Previous experience with Google Cloud Platform is highly
desirable. Your talent for communicating with both non technical stakeholders will be
crucial in ensuring successful client interactions.
Your Responsibilities
Create and present solutions: Design innovative cloud architectures
encompassing infrastructure, security and networking layouts across cloud
platforms. Demonstrate solutions through presentations, demos and workshops.
Architect transformative solutions:Create scalable, secure and cost efficient
cloud architectures customized to meet client requirements while leveraging the
strengths of GCP whenever possible.
Promote cloud adoption; Advise clients on practices for cloud usage, migration
strategies and optimization techniques to enhance their investment in cloud
technologies.
Act as a trusted advisor: Offer guidance to clients on practices for transitioning
to the cloud optimizing strategies and managing costs in alignment with their
business objectives.
Lead technical discussions: Explain the benefits of suggested solutions, tackle
issues and establish rapport with potential clients.
Stay updated on the trends: Keep an understanding of new developments, in
cloud technologies and related areas.
Collaborate with sales teams; Lead the aspects of the sales process by
understanding client requirements and developing cloud architecture proposals.
What We Need To See From You
Proven track record: At least 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture
design and implementation, with a strong focus on cloud solutions with Strong
skills in GCP environment would be appreciated.
Cloud Expertise: Deep proficiency in core cloud concepts, infrastructure (IaaS),
platform services (PaaS), security, networking, and cost optimization. Skills in
Vmware environments is a plus.
GCP Advantage: Strong working knowledge of Google Cloud Platform services
(Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Cloud Storage, Networking, etc.) with a GCP
professional certifications. Knowledge in other hyperscale areas would also be
appreciated.
Strong skills in solution's design: Ability to translate business needs into
compelling cloud solutions, effectively present technical concepts, and handle
objections.
Communication excellence: Outstanding written and verbal communication
skills, adapting your communication style to different audiences. Fluent French and advanced English
Benefits
Opportunities for professional development, training, and certifications
Collaborative and dynamic work environment within a leading IT company
Job Function
Software & Cloud Services

State-of-the-art Procurement & Sourcing to drive efficiency and better manage risks
High-Performing Global Team for stronger partnerships with AXA entities
Working as part the Group‚Äôs Technology Office, the
Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect,
is responsible for providing architecture, vision, governance, problem anticipation and solving for IT on a transversal architectural level. This transversal scope of the architecture covers business, security, data, application and technology architecture.
He manages and coordinates, for his areas of responsibility ‚Äì here transversal Workplace topics ‚Äì , the work carried out by the other Architects cross-domains and Chief Architects / Chief Technology Officers from AXA Group Operations and AXA entities in close collaboration with GO departments for the global assets, with Group Security for the Security part, and with Business Partnership and the Markets/Entities for the entities related part.
Transversal
Workplace topics
scope will cover this non exhaustive list:
Device Management
Application delivery
Collaboration & Productivity
UX / QoS Monitoring
Workplace interaction with other domains (Security, IAM, Network, Cloud, Compliance‚Ä¶)
The
Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect
's role is to
steer the Architecture evolution
across AXA to ensure the
proper implementation
of the IT Strategy and to be able to adopt new technologies and new market solutions in line with the business priorities, the foundations of the products structure and with the aim support AXA to become a Tech Led Company.
The individual in this position understands the Group business strategy, the Information Systems (IS) of the Group and anticipates future directions of the IT industry to relate them to future business needs and initiatives. The Lead Architect Expert produces
key architecture deliverables
, leads international workgroups and studies to
establish IT directions
for the Group and is responsible for the architecture review of projects related to technologies in his domain of responsibility.
MAIN MISSIONS :
The objective of architecture is to ensure that we build sustainable, robust and secured Information Systems at the right cost and that bring business value to support the corporate business and lines of business strategies.
The Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect main activity is to craft the IT Strategy of the Group and act as a change agent to implement this IT Strategy through the Target Enterprise Architecture of the Group, and of individual countries within the Group. He may also be called upon to directly support PMs on some key projects.
The core activities of the Lead Architect Expert include the following for his own area of responsibility :
1- Vision and Strategy
Support the definition and management of the company Technology vision, strategies and plans with focus on domains related to his role
2- Contribute to Technology/Architecture CTO Community and Technology Governance of the Group:
To cover global and local dimensions, which includes ensuring design and solution choices made in the entities are conform to Group Strategy in order to secure Group interests over the long-term (Architecture boards‚Ä¶)
To share technological visions, opportunities, and risks company-wide, and in particular interact with senior business and IT executives
3- Define, build and maintain architecture & design patterns, jointly with Product engineering teams aiming to minimize technical complexity and leverage convergence opportunities:
Architecture landscape
Architecture Model & Maturity
Architecture evolution and product design blueprints, HLD
Supporting LLD delivery with Product teams
4- Market Watch:
Participate to forums of leading companies (cross-industries) and vendors in order to use and/or influence technology evolutions
In particular, study industry trends and technologies in close collaboration with Group Data & Technology Innovation
Manage evaluation, development, and deployment of relevant technologies (technology lifecycle & roadmaps)
5- Provide support to all Group IT supporting functions, in particular for Procurement and Finance for large negotiations or assets
PROFILE
Experience :
Strong experience in IT Strategy, enterprise and solution architecture (10+ years)
Experience on solutions architecture designs for very large projects/environments in particular in Workplace (both Device management and Collaboration)
Strong change management skills with practical experience of transformation in an international environment
Financials (princiles, business cases, budgeting, business-planning, savings)
Strives for excellence with deliverables of high quality and ability to work in sometimes tight planning
Demonstrates to be a strong team member with an open and collaborative mind-set.
Soft skills :
The person will have to interact and collaborate with multiple global and local stakeholders and different levels (peers, managers, experts, C-Levels‚Ä¶). To succeed in his role, this can be achieved through:
Leadership ‚Äì Exhibits strong results orientation, change leadership, adaptability and the ability to drive collaborative behaviour.
Openness and reaching out ‚Äì Strong human relationship skills, exhibit curiosity and can see opportunities in situations, not just problems.
Communication skills ‚Äì Exhibits strong skills in listening, spoken and written communication, collaboration and the ability to work in a global team. Lead Architect Experts are expected to have the ability to understand and discuss with both senior managers and IT, and explain in clear language complicated architectural concepts and strategies.
Vision ‚Äì Lead Architecture Expert demonstrates architectural vision and beliefs and is able to express them clearly, champion them, and debate his point of view in on-line forums or in-person workshops.
Embracing of the new AXA values and new ways of working with courage to promote them against tradition
Openness to different opinions and creation of consensus
Problem solving orientation and strong analytical, logical and interpretive ability to interpret scenarios, express concepts or models with several dimensions: architecture, business value, procurement, program approach ‚Ä¶
Has a deep understanding of the organizational structures, in order to be in a position to better identify improvement points
International profile ‚Äì A proven ability to work effectively in an international environment. In addition, exhibits a strong proficiency in English.
Technical skills :
Expert knowledge in IT strategy focusing on Workplace Architecture with related infrastructure good practices
Expertise in Workplace with critical thinking and decision making, information systems knowledge, innovation, knowledge of emerging technology, planning, risk management, systems thinking, application rationalization/TCO, IT Security and technical problem solving.
Good expertise in the practice of Architecture (frameworks) to deliver a holistic view (architecture model)

title: data architect

description:
The
EIB
, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its newly created Centre of Excellence, a
(
Senior) Cloud Solution Architect (Azure) ‚Äì based in Poland
*
. This position will be part of
Group Corporate Services Directorate ‚Äì Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) ‚Äì Platforms and Services Department (P&S)
- Cloud Enablement Unit (CET)
located in the
EIB External Office in Warsaw, Poland
.
This is a full-time temporary position at grade 5/6 in Warsaw, Poland. The term of the contract will be 4 years.
internal benchmark (Senior) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure
Purpose
Are you ready to contribute to a sustainable future and be at the heart of the European Union's Climate Bank's digital evolution? The European Investment Bank (EIB) is on a strategic mission to integrate advanced IT technologies, enhancing our business efficacy and the interaction experience with our clients and partners. Our Digital Transformation's success is energized by the diverse array of our team's skills, profound expertise, and dedication to bringing our forward-thinking vision to life. While we‚Äôre headquartered in the vibrant city of Luxembourg, we‚Äôre excited to establish a Centre of Excellence in the dynamic hub of Warsaw!
We are on the lead of cloud transformation, empowering our teams and stakeholders to embrace the rhythm of change and innovation. As part of our Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE), you'll join a mission-driven team that's reshaping the EIB digital landscape. Our journey is about creating value, enhancing resilience, and paving the way for a future where cloud enablement is a cornerstone of business agility.
Your mission? To play a key role in developing the foundations of our cloud platforms, focusing on Azure. Your expertise will be key in designing and automating cloud infrastructures ensuring they're scalable, secure, and aligned with the EIB Group objectives.
Operating Network
You will report directly to the Head of Cloud Enablement Team. You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. As you will be based in Warsaw some business travel to the EIB Headquarters in Luxembourg is foreseen.
Accountabilities
Design and implement cloud solutions with a focus on Azure, while also leveraging AWS for a multi-cloud approach
Develop landing zones and blueprints in collaboration with technical teams to support scalable and well-architected cloud environments
Lead the design and automation of cloud infrastructure, ensuring it meets our digital transformation objectives
Support teams leading technology roadmap, by providing technology advice and, where applicable, assisting in the implementation of cloud components
Collaborate with Cloud Governance and program leads to establish guidelines, roles, and responsibilities across projects
Engage in continuous learning to deepen expertise in Azure and cloud technologies, including security, network architecture, storage, containerization, identity and access management, amongst other
Translate technical solutions into business value, making cloud technologies accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate closely with other teams‚Äô part of the CCoE in view of delivering the expected cloud transformation roadmap, especially in relation to items dependent or relying on cloud platform foundation capabilities (Azure)
Qualifications
University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
At least 5 years of experience in cloud development and/or operations with the focus on architecting, building, maintaining, and securing cloud technologies
Proven experience of delivering underlying cloud platforms as product, (Azure) ideally within transformation programs, including rollout of new technologies.
Experience working with public, hybrid and on-premises private clouds would be an advantage
Extensive technological expertise in IT, in particular within Azure cloud domain (Public/Private services; Operations & Administration, Architecture, Security control services, Containerisation, hybrid cloud)
Up-to-date knowledge of market trends and developments in the domain and broader IT sector
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.
Competencies
Find out more about EIB core competencies
here
(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of
level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.
Additional Information
The remuneration of staff hired directly at a post in an external office within the EU may be adapted to the costs of living of the respective country. Please follow the link We invest in you.
We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
Deadline for applications:
This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until the positions are filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

description:
AXA GROUP OPERATIONS
AXA is becoming a sustainable tech-led company and at AXA Group Operations we are one of the major catalysts for this transformation.
We set the tone by triggering and empowering the evolution of our insurance business model through technology and innovation, driving its concrete implementation globally at speed, with a high quality of advisory and execution.
We are present across 17 countries with committed, highly qualified teams. We leverage technology, data, sourcing, security and investment allocation in a global way, but also achieve economies of scale and synergies when necessary.
At
AXA Group Operations
, we want to be recognized in three fields of action:
State-of-the-art Data Technology to drive customer experience
State-of-the-art Procurement & Sourcing to drive efficiency and better manage risks
High-Performing Global Team for stronger partnerships with AXA entities
Working as part the Group‚Äôs Technology Office, the
Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect,
is responsible for providing architecture, vision, governance, problem anticipation and solving for IT on a transversal architectural level. This transversal scope of the architecture covers business, security, data, application and technology architecture.
He manages and coordinates, for his areas of responsibility ‚Äì here transversal Workplace topics ‚Äì , the work carried out by the other Architects cross-domains and Chief Architects / Chief Technology Officers from AXA Group Operations and AXA entities in close collaboration with GO departments for the global assets, with Group Security for the Security part, and with Business Partnership and the Markets/Entities for the entities related part.
Transversal
Workplace topics
scope will cover this non exhaustive list:
Device Management
Application delivery
Collaboration & Productivity
UX / QoS Monitoring
Workplace interaction with other domains (Security, IAM, Network, Cloud, Compliance‚Ä¶)
The
Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect
's role is to
steer the Architecture evolution
across AXA to ensure the
proper implementation
of the IT Strategy and to be able to adopt new technologies and new market solutions in line with the business priorities, the foundations of the products structure and with the aim support AXA to become a Tech Led Company.
The individual in this position understands the Group business strategy, the Information Systems (IS) of the Group and anticipates future directions of the IT industry to relate them to future business needs and initiatives. The Lead Architect Expert produces
key architecture deliverables
, leads international workgroups and studies to
establish IT directions
for the Group and is responsible for the architecture review of projects related to technologies in his domain of responsibility.
MAIN MISSIONS :
The objective of architecture is to ensure that we build sustainable, robust and secured Information Systems at the right cost and that bring business value to support the corporate business and lines of business strategies.
The Digital Workplace Entrerprise Architect main activity is to craft the IT Strategy of the Group and act as a change agent to implement this IT Strategy through the Target Enterprise Architecture of the Group, and of individual countries within the Group. He may also be called upon to directly support PMs on some key projects.
The core activities of the Lead Architect Expert include the following for his own area of responsibility :
1- Vision and Strategy
Support the definition and management of the company Technology vision, strategies and plans with focus on domains related to his role
2- Contribute to Technology/Architecture CTO Community and Technology Governance of the Group:
To cover global and local dimensions, which includes ensuring design and solution choices made in the entities are conform to Group Strategy in order to secure Group interests over the long-term (Architecture boards‚Ä¶)
To share technological visions, opportunities, and risks company-wide, and in particular interact with senior business and IT executives
3- Define, build and maintain architecture & design patterns, jointly with Product engineering teams aiming to minimize technical complexity and leverage convergence opportunities:
Architecture landscape
Architecture Model & Maturity
Architecture evolution and product design blueprints, HLD
Supporting LLD delivery with Product teams
4- Market Watch:
Participate to forums of leading companies (cross-industries) and vendors in order to use and/or influence technology evolutions
In particular, study industry trends and technologies in close collaboration with Group Data & Technology Innovation
Manage evaluation, development, and deployment of relevant technologies (technology lifecycle & roadmaps)
5- Provide support to all Group IT supporting functions, in particular for Procurement and Finance for large negotiations or assets
PROFILE
Experience :
Strong experience in IT Strategy, enterprise and solution architecture (10+ years)
Experience on solutions architecture designs for very large projects/environments in particular in Workplace (both Device management and Collaboration)
Strong change management skills with practical experience of transformation in an international environment
Financials (princiles, business cases, budgeting, business-planning, savings)
Strives for excellence with deliverables of high quality and ability to work in sometimes tight planning
Demonstrates to be a strong team member with an open and collaborative mind-set.
Soft skills :
The person will have to interact and collaborate with multiple global and local stakeholders and different levels (peers, managers, experts, C-Levels‚Ä¶). To succeed in his role, this can be achieved through:
Leadership ‚Äì Exhibits strong results orientation, change leadership, adaptability and the ability to drive collaborative behaviour.
Openness and reaching out ‚Äì Strong human relationship skills, exhibit curiosity and can see opportunities in situations, not just problems.
Communication skills ‚Äì Exhibits strong skills in listening, spoken and written communication, collaboration and the ability to work in a global team. Lead Architect Experts are expected to have the ability to understand and discuss with both senior managers and IT, and explain in clear language complicated architectural concepts and strategies.
Vision ‚Äì Lead Architecture Expert demonstrates architectural vision and beliefs and is able to express them clearly, champion them, and debate his point of view in on-line forums or in-person workshops.
Embracing of the new AXA values and new ways of working with courage to promote them against tradition
Openness to different opinions and creation of consensus
Problem solving orientation and strong analytical, logical and interpretive ability to interpret scenarios, express concepts or models with several dimensions: architecture, business value, procurement, program approach ‚Ä¶
Has a deep understanding of the organizational structures, in order to be in a position to better identify improvement points
International profile ‚Äì A proven ability to work effectively in an international environment. In addition, exhibits a strong proficiency in English.
Technical skills :
Expert knowledge in IT strategy focusing on Workplace Architecture with related infrastructure good practices
Expertise in Workplace with critical thinking and decision making, information systems knowledge, innovation, knowledge of emerging technology, planning, risk management, systems thinking, application rationalization/TCO, IT Security and technical problem solving.
Good expertise in the practice of Architecture (frameworks) to deliver a holistic view (architecture model)

description:
Coders Connect
and
Sanofi
are joining forces to bring an electrifying twist to the biopharmaceutical world!
Work with a rhythm that suits your style (2 days remote and 3 days onsite magic).
Language:
Proficiency in English is required for this role to ensure effective communication within our diverse, global team.
About Sanofi:
We're not just a company; we're a global movement, focused on human health and making a real difference. Our mission? To battle pain, ease suffering, and sprinkle a little bit of magic in the process by developing life-changing medicines and vaccines through breakthrough science and wizard-level technology.
Digital & Data: The Pulse of Our Mission
At the heart of our quest lies our digital and data powerhouse. Think of us as the digital healthcare platform of your dreams, where innovation meets speed, and technology shakes hands with medicine. With our scale, deep-rooted connections in health ecosystems worldwide, and a knack for pushing boundaries, we're here to revolutionize medicine, one digital solution at a time.
Your Mission as a Solution Architect:
‚Äã
As our Solution Architect, you're the master planner of our digital architecture, crafting scalable and sustainable solutions that power advanced analytics, AI, and ML initiatives. You'll design the blueprint for our data platforms and technology stacks, ensuring they align with our strategic goals and adhere to the highest standards of quality and innovation.
Requirements
Cloud Mastery:
Deep expertise in cloud-based services, particularly AWS managed services, to architect scalable and resilient solutions.
Agile and DevOps:
A solid foundation in Agile development processes and DevOps principles, including proficiency with GIT (GitHub), CI/CD practices (GitHub Actions), and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
Tech Stack Expertise
: Hands-on experience with Linux, containers (Kubernetes), serverless architectures, and programming skills in JavaScript, Node.js, React, and Flutter.
Data Engineering:
Knowledge of SQL, relational databases (AWS RDS), and familiarity with data warehousing solutions like Snowflake and AWS Redshift. Integration Services experience (Informatica Cloud, Airflow) is a significant plus.
Messaging and Integration:
Competency in messaging solutions (EventBridge, SNS, SQS, Rabbit MQ, Kafka) to ensure seamless data flow and integration across systems.
Compliance and Security:
Awareness of compliance and cybersecurity requirements in the healthcare industry, with experience in navigating quality, regulatory data privacy (GxP, SOX) standards.
Certifications:
Relevant cloud certifications (AWS, Azure, Snowflake) are highly regarded, reflecting a commitment to staying at the forefront of technology.
The Reward:
A chance to play a crucial role in a collaboration that's redefining healthcare through digital transformation.
A seat at the round table of diversity and inclusion, where different backgrounds and experiences conjure the richness of our culture.
An endless horizon of professional growth, learning opportunities, and the chance to contribute to a future where better health is a global reality.
The Call to Adventure:
If you're ready to join a quest for better ‚Äì better treatments, better outcomes, and better science ‚Äì and believe in the magic of bringing diverse talents together to make miracles happen, we want you. Let's embark on this journey together and transform the future of healthcare.
Better is out there. Are you ready to find it with us?

description:
With Confluent, organisations can harness the full power of continuously flowing data to innovate and win in the modern digital world. We have a purpose that drives us to do better every day ‚Äì we're creating an entirely new category within data infrastructure - data streaming. This technology will allow every organisation to create experiences and use the power of data in ways that profoundly impact the way we all live. This impact is our purpose and drives us to do better every day.
One Confluent. One team. One Data Streaming Platform.
Data Connects Us.
About The Role
We‚Äôre seeking a strong technologist who will support and grow the technical partnerships with key Global System Integrators. This role is pivotal in supporting and advancing technical partnerships through a variety of initiatives including co-developed solutions, strategic account engagements, and fostering the growth of Centers of Excellence among our partners. . You‚Äôll be accountable for the outcome of these initiatives and frequently collaborate with both Confluent and Partner resources to drive success.
Successful Partner Solutions Engineers typically have backgrounds as Technical Account Managers, Solution Engineers, or Professional Services. Still, they all share a passion for expanding Confluent‚Äôs partner ecosystem and delivering our customers the best of that world. For this role we are looking for a professional who has experience in working with GSIs and their technical executive stakeholders.
What You Will Do
Helping a customer determine his/her platform and/or application strategy for moving to a more real-time, event-based business. Such engagements often involve remote preparation; presenting an onsite or remote workshop for the customer‚Äôs architects, developers, and operations teams; investigating (with Engineering and other coworkers) solutions to difficult challenges; and writing a recommendations summary doc.
Providing feedback to the Confluent Product and Engineering groups
Building tooling for another team or the wider company to help us push our technical boundaries and improve our ability to deliver consistently with high quality
Testing performance and functionality of new components developed by Engineering
Writing or editing documentation and knowledge base articles, including reference architecture materials and design patterns based on customer experiencesHoning your skills, building applications, or trying out new product featuresParticipating in community and industry events
Participating in community and industry events
What You Will Bring
Deep experience designing, building, and operating in-production Big Data, stream processing, and/or enterprise data integration solutions, ideally using Apache Kafka
Demonstrated experience successfully managing multiple B2B infrastructure software development projects, including driving expansion, customer satisfaction, feature adoption, and retention
Experience operating Linux (configure, tune, and troubleshoot both RedHat and Debian-based distributions)
Experience using cloud providers (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure) for running high-throughput systems
Experience with Java Virtual Machine (JVM) tuning and troubleshooting
Experience with distributed systems (Kafka, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.)
Proficiency in Java
Strong desire to tackle hard technical problems, and proven ability to do so with little or no direct daily supervision
Excellent communication skills, with an ability to clearly and concisely explain tricky issues and complex solutions
Ability to quickly learn new technologies
Ability and willingness to travel up to 50% of the time to meet with customers
Come As You Are
At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

title: data architect

description:
Description
Startup Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with startups of different stages. Supporting the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS, they work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. Solutions Architects also have broader impact at scale, taking a leading role in creating and presenting technical content and best practices.
In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will be learning something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
Key job responsibilities
As a Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers to accelerate their projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes.
You will own the technical relationship with the customer and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
Share the voice of the customer to influence the roadmap of new features and services for the AWS platform.
Create and capture best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
Evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organization by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.
Collaborate within the startup ecosystem (accelerators, incubators, VCs and meetups) to educate startups and support their growth.
A day in the life
The Solutions Architect team at AWS is responsible for helping customers successfully implement cloud technologies. In a typical week you will meet multiple customers and you will collaborate with them on designing and operating well-architected solutions. You will earn their trust and show them the art of the possible, educating them around the capabilities of AWS. Partnering with internal teams and experts, leveraging a deep knowledge of our tools and products, you‚Äôll craft highly-scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that address our customers‚Äô business problems. As part of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to continuously learn and innovate daily.
About The Team
The AWS Startup Solutions Architecture team is dedicated to working with startup companies as they build and scale their businesses. We‚Äôre here to make sure that they can deploy the best, most scalable, and most secure architectures possible ‚Äì and that they spend as little time and money as possible doing so. We are a group of technologists with varied backgrounds; from fresh graduates to ex-CTOs, all growing our skills and startup expertise, while working on cutting edge technology use-cases with some of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies.
About Aws
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship and Career growth
We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
Courbevoie, FRA
Basic Qualifications
Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
Experience of Software, Systems or Data Design
Fluency in French and English
Preferred Qualifications
Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT projects - either on premises or in the cloud
Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.)
In depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, analytics, Machine Learning, highly secured workloads etc.
CTO/co-founder/architect experience for a VC-backed technology startup company

Nous prenons nos d√©cisions de recrutement en fonction de votre exp√©rience et de vos comp√©tences. Nous appr√©cions votre envie de d√©couvrir, d'inventer, de simplifier et de construire. La protection de votre vie priv√©e et la s√©curit√© de vos donn√©es constituent depuis longtemps une priorit√© absolue pour Amazon.
